message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.SI, cs.CL 

This paper focuses on the implementation challenges of real-time Twitter search, which involves indexing and searching tweets arriving at a rate of several thousands per second. The paper specifically addresses the issue of dynamic postings allocation policies for index structures that are completely held in main memory. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), Databases (cs.DB), Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), or Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-categories.
